page.title: 03VALE FARM, WHITEGATE
page.content: To encourage these animals, the farmer has planted many trees, including silver birch and scots pine. The owner refuses to use chemical sprays. Instead she digs up the ragwort and burns it. This plant is most poisonous when the flowers turn from green to yellow to brown. The cows are attracted to the sweet smell. They then eat the flowers and often die. The farm has a copper deficiency in the soil. To counteract this the farmer ties mineral blocks containing copper, zinc and magnesium, to her fences for her cattle to feed upon as an extra vitamin. The owner also places Rumaviten in water troughs to aid digestion. Another feature of the farm is the beautiful eye-catching white farmhouse.
